com.lespea.cef.utils
Class StringUtils

java.lang.Object
  com.lespea.cef.utils.StringUtils

public final class StringUtils
extends java.lang.Object

Utility functions that manipulate strings to work correctly with the CEF format

Version:
1.0, 2011-07-19
Author:
Adam Lesperance

Method Detail

escapeExtensionKey

public static java.lang.String escapeExtensionKey(java.lang.String keyStr)
                                           throws InvalidExtensionKey
Every key in a CEF extension map must escape the ='s character

Null strings return null for now.

Parameters:
keyStr - the text of the extension value that requires escaping
Returns:
the escaped version of the extension value string
Throws:
InvalidExtensionKey - if the key is invalid

escapeExtensionValue

public static java.lang.String escapeExtensionValue(java.lang.String valueStr)
Every value in a CEF extension map must escape the = character and all newline characters (\r and \n) should be turned into their string equivalent.

Null strings return null for now.

Parameters:
valueStr - the text of the extension value that requires escaping
Returns:
the escaped version of the extension value string

escapeField

public static java.lang.String escapeField(java.lang.String fieldStr)
                                    throws InvalidField
Every field in a CEF string (minus the extension) must escape the bar ("|") character as well as the backslash ("\").

Additionally, the field string may not contain a vertical newline character and, if one is found, then an IllegalArgument exception is thrown!

Null strings return null for now.

Parameters:
fieldStr - the text of the field that requires escaping
Returns:
the escaped version of the field string
Throws:
InvalidField - if the string to be escaped is invalid according to the CEF spec

isValidExtensionKey

public static java.lang.Boolean isValidExtensionKey(java.lang.String extensionKeyStr)
Tests if the provided string is a valid extension key string.

A field is not valid if it contains a whitespace character

Parameters:
extensionKeyStr - the extension key string to test
Returns:
if the extension key string contains a whitespace character

isValidExtensionValue

public static java.lang.Boolean isValidExtensionValue(java.lang.String extensionValueStr)
Tests if the provided string is a valid extension value string

Essentially everything is valid except for nulls

Parameters:
extensionValueStr - the extension value to test
Returns:
if the extension value string is null or not

isValidField

public static java.lang.Boolean isValidField(java.lang.String fieldStr)
Tests if the provided string is a valid field string.

A field is not valid if it contains a vertical newline character

Parameters:
fieldStr - the field string to test
Returns:
if the field string contains a vertical newline character
